intro: Prunella vulgaris var. major, commonly known as self-heal, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with square, hairy stems and opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers arranged in whorls along the stem, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its roots and leaves are used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported healing properties. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed areas.
